meanings.definition: Of or relating to tissues or organs that are genetically identical.
meanings.sent1: The syngenic twins had the same DNA and looked very similar.
meanings.sent2: The scientists studied the syngenic cells to understand genetic similarities.
meanings.sent3: The syngenic flowers in the garden were so identical that it was hard to tell them apart.
meanings.sent4: The syngenic leaves on the tree seemed to dance in perfect unison.
meanings.sent5: The syngenic puppies were like mirror images of each other, with matching fur patterns.

meanings.definition: A genetic match between individuals, especially in the context of organ or tissue transplantation.
meanings.sent1: The syngenic between the donor and recipient was crucial for the successful transplant.
meanings.sent2: The hospital prioritized finding a syngenic for the patient in need of a kidney.
meanings.sent3: The syngenic for the heart transplant was found just in time, bringing hope to the patient.
meanings.sent4: The syngenic relationship between the siblings made the organ donation process smoother.
meanings.sent5: The syngenic bond between the twins made them ideal candidates for the organ transplant.
